metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7645 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
Adobe Flash Player 18.x through 18.0.0.252 and 19.x through 19.0.0.207 on Windows and OS X and 11.x through 11.2.202.535 on Linux allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted SWF file, as exploited in the wild in October 2015.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 11.2.202.535ubuntu0.14.04.1
flashplugin-installer - 11.2.202.535ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.2.202.535ubuntu0.14.04.1').
